entry.title: SAP TM Freight Agreement Approval Workflow Process and Set Up.
entry.content:
Understanding Freight Agreement Approval

Freight agreement approval workflow is an organized process used to manage the review and authorization of freight contracts within a company. It usually includes collaboration between various departments such as procurement, legal, finance and logistics. The goal is to ensure that every part of the agreement complies with internal policies and meets all legal and regulatory standards.

Key Components of an Effective Freight Agreement Approval Workflow

  • Centralized storage for all freight agreements with easy access.
  • Automatic routing to relevant stakeholders based on set criteria.
  • Role-based access control to ensure proper review and approval
  • Real-time tracking and audit trails for full transparency.

Business Benefits of a Freight Agreement Workflow

  • Faster approvals with automated workflows and defined processes.
  • Better cost control by spotting rate issues and managing freight spend.
  • Improved compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
  • Greater transparency and accountability with full audit tracking.
  • Stronger carrier partnerships through consistent agreement handling.

Freight Agreement Approval Workflow ‚Äì Configuration Steps 

  1. Org Level Configuration 
  2. Workflow Configuration 
  3. Freight Agreement Type Configuration 

1. Org Level Configuration 

  • All previously created organizational units are visible in the transaction code PPOME. 
  • Go to the organization unit, select your purchasing organization, and click Create. 
  • User IDs for the users who approve the freight agreement should be created in the backend. 
  • Create a position as Freight Agreement Approver. 
  • Select the Freight Agreement Approver option and click on Assign, then assign the user ID. 
  • Select the checkbox Head of Own Organizational Unit.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WF_APPROVER is the USER which will approve the Freight agreement.

 

 

2.Workflow Configuration 

Perform following steps to trigger a workflow for Agreement 

1.Goto transaction SWDD‚ÄØ 
2.Go to Workflow -> Other workflow/version ‚Äì then enter task WS71100

 

 

 

 

3.Go to Go To->Basic Data.

 

 

Again, Go To->Agent Assignment for task‚ÄØ

 

Click on Attributes and select General Task

 

 

Then click on Update Index icon to generate the index.‚ÄØ

 

Return to the previous screen by pressing F3 twice.‚ÄØ

4. Now click on the second step of this workflow.  

 

Go to Decision tab->Agents, select Organization unit and enter the Purchasing organization. So that it allows the users assigned to this purchasing organization to approve/reject the workflow.

 

Go to Control tab->Agent Assignment‚ÄØ 

 

 

 

     

Click on Update Index to generate index. 

 

 

 

Return to the previous screen by pressing F3 twice.‚ÄØ                                                           

5. Mark BUSINESS OBJECT as import parameter on Workflow container. Applicable from S4 CORE 106 onwards.‚ÄØ 

Select Workflow Container from the left side of the screen

 

 

Then select BUSINESSOBJECT from Element, and then set Import check box under Properties tab.‚ÄØ   

 

 

 

Then save and activate the workflow task.

 

 

Additional Tips:‚ÄØ

Make sure workflow RFC destination is created‚ÄØ

 

 

Workflow tasks status can be viewed on transaction SWI1‚ÄØ 

3.Freight Agreement Type Configuration 

Create a new freight agreement type for the freight agreement approval workflow. 
In the freight agreement type, select the Approval Workflow checkbox to enable workflow-based approval.

 

 

Test case 1: Confirm Approval Request 

Freight agreement approval notification: 
Go to the freight agreement and click on the Request Approval button to initiate the approval process. 

 

Once you click on Request for Approval, the lifecycle status of the freight agreement is updated to Awaiting Approval. 

 

 

 

An email notification will be sent to the respective users assigned to the purchasing organization.  

Check ‚ÄòMy Inbox‚Äô app or transaction SBWP to take action. 

 

 

Click on Confirm Approval Request ‚Äì the freight agreement lifecycle status will be updated to Released. 

 

 

Test Case2: Reject Approval Request 

If Approver wants to reject the freight agreement approval, click on the ‚ÄòReject Approval Check‚Äô.

 

 

If Approver wants to reject the freight agreement approval, click on the ‚ÄòReject Approval Check‚Äô.

 

The lifecycle status of the freight agreement is  ‚ÄòIn Process‚Äô. 

 

Note: if there are multi-level approval required that is also possible.

Conclusion

The Freight Agreement Approval Workflow plays a key role in controlling transportation costs and maintaining compliance with agreed terms. By automating the approval process, it reduces delays, minimizes errors, and improves transparency across departments. With features like tiered approvals, audit trails, and real-time notifications, it ensures that agreements are reviewed quickly and securely. Integrating this workflow into your logistics or SAPTM system strengthens supplier relationships and improves contract management. Ultimately, it helps teams make better decisions and aligns logistics operations with overall business goals.

entry.title: Re: Couldn't subscribe to Integration Suite. Try again. I...
entry.content:
I encountered a similar issue, and the following steps resolve it:
- Go to Subscriptions and delete the existing Integration Suite.
- Go to the Service Marketplace, locate Integration Suite, and click on the three dots ‚Üí Create, you might see an error message stating that no subscription exists, just ignore it. The subscription will be created automatically.

I don‚Äôt have a clear logical explanation for this behavior; it seems to be an internal BTP issue. However, these steps worked for me.

entry.title: Re: Double Periods (". . ") Not Throwing Syntax Error In...
entry.content:
Hello Rohan,

This is actually expected behavior in ABAP.

In ABAP, the period (.) is a statement terminator. When you write something like:

WRITE: 'SUCCESS'..

the compiler interprets it as:

WRITE: 'SUCCESS' . .

  • The first ( . ) terminates the WRITE statement.

  • The second ( . ) is treated as an empty statement, which is syntactically valid in ABAP and simply does nothing.

That‚Äôs why the compiler does not throw a syntax error, and the program still activates and runs successfully.

The same logic applies when you add an extra period after ( ENDIF. ) or any other statement ‚Äî ABAP just considers it as an additional empty statement.

So, it‚Äôs not a bug or an error, but an intentional design of the ABAP syntax rules.

entry.title: Re: SAP Precalculation Server "ERROR: program BIPRECXY no...
entry.content:
Found the Solution. In TA "RSPRECALCADMIN" was no option to select an gateway-host. 

Needed to add this option via Note 1496606 - RSPRECALCADMIN: allow entry of gateway host - SAP for Me

  • Use transaction SE38 to add the following text element to report RS_PRECALC_ADMIN: 089 Gateway Host
  • Use transaction SE11 to change the Data Type RSR_PRECALC_ADMIN_SERVER. Add the Component GWHOST with Component Type RFCGWHOST.

We are using an SAPROUTER as proxy so i had to add saprouterstring to the gateway-host.

entry.title: Re: Step-by-Step Guide: Sending SAP Data to SAP Event Mesh in Integration Suite (EMIS). Codeless.
entry.content:
Hi @acmebcn ,

You only need the ROOT CA, which is at the top of the certificate chain.
When sending a message, you can check the response from the cloud in transaction /n/ASADEV/ACI_MONITOR.
In the response, you can see whether the message successfully reached SAP Event Mesh or, in case of an error (e.g., SSL certificate issues), why it failed.

Kind Regards,
Benedikt

entry.title: How to consume OData service in Fiori app using approuter and destination in Cloud Foundry (404 Not
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am developing a CAP project on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry. I want to consume an OData V4 service from a Fiori (UI5) application using approuter and a destination.

- Backend (CAP, OData V4):
https://<subdomain>-back.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/v4/invitacion/ReadProveedor

- Frontend (Fiori + approuter):
https://<subdomain>-frontend.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/frontfront/index.html

### Approuter (xs-app.json)
```json
{
"welcomeFile": "/frontfront/index.html",
"routes": [
{
"source": "^/backend/(.*)$",
"target": "/$1",
"destination": "SRV_BACKEND",
"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
}
]
}

 

 

Destination in BTP cockpit

  • Name: SRV_BACKEND
  • URL: https://-back.cfapps..hana.ondemand.com
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • Authentication: OAuth2JWTBearer

 

Frontend manifest.json

"dataSources": {
"backend_odata": {
"uri": "/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
}
}

 

Problem

When the app tries to load metadata (/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/$metadata), I receive 404 Not Found.

Accessing the backend service directly via its URL works fine.

What I tried

  • Verified that the destination exists in BTP cockpit and points to the backend URL.
  • Checked the backend service directly (responds correctly).
  • Reviewed approuter logs ‚Äî I see messages like ‚ÄúMissing internal url for request ‚Ä¶‚Äù.

What configuration should I adjust in the approuter or the destination so that the frontend Fiori app can correctly consume the OData service via /backend/...?

Any guidance or working examples would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products
entry.content:
Hi,

Explained as below in blog,

"After activating the Data Package in the SAP BDC Cockpit,  APRS is pushing to target HANA Data Lake Files i.e. SAP BDC Foundational services (FOS) layer."

 

If activating a data package already starts pushing S/4HANA data to the target HANA Data Lake Files‚Äîi.e., the SAP BDC Foundational Services (FOS) layer‚Äîthen why is a separate replication flow or federation via remote table still required to ingest the data into a Datasphere space?


Shouldn‚Äôt it be possible to simply consume the data directly by sharing it from the BDC FOS (HDLF) layer into the Datasphere space, instead of reloading it again? If activating a data package already starts pushing S/4HANA data to the target HANA Data Lake Files‚Äîi.e., the SAP BDC Foundational Services (FOS) layer‚Äîthen why is a separate replication flow still required to ingest the data into a Datasphere space?

entry.title: Should I take Modvigil as soon as I wake up?
entry.content: It is normally advised to take Modvigil as soon as you wake up, particularly if you are using it to treat narcolepsy or excessive daytime drowsiness. Early use lowers the chance of sleeplessness at night and increases alertness during the day. Take it with water and on an empty stomach for optimal effects. Modvigil should be taken around an hour prior to the start of your shift if you are taking it to treat shift work sleep disturbance. Because time might vary depending on your daily activity and particular ailment, always heed your doctor's advise.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on how ‚ÄúLinked Object‚Äù is populated for...
entry.content:
Hi @ludgero_vasconcelos 

In our understanding and according to our experience the OCNLearningEvents API only allows you to send completion status on item level but not on content object level.

In our understanding OCN completions only work fine if you have a 1:1 relationship between an LMS item and an OCN Course of your OCN Content Provider. 

To compare: With Scorm 1.2 you can complete a single content object within an item. So an item can have several content objects that have to be completed one by one before the whole item ist marked as completed. But this logic doesn't exist in OCN context. OCN always completes the whole item.

KR Jonas

entry.title: Re: Getting the list of transport requests which will be...
entry.content:
Hello Bruno,

You can find the ‚ÄúTransport Analysis‚Äù card via the ‚ÄúCross-Project Overview‚Äù app. Here is what the In-App Help says bout this app:

"In the Transport Analysis app, you get an overview of all your system transports. You can search transports and check which feature they are assigned to.

You can do the following with this app:

  • View assigned transports
  • View where transports are deployed
  • View the stage of a transport
  • View affected features of a failed transport
  • Search all transports in Production
  • View all source tenants
  • View transports that are not yet assigned to Features"

Maybe this helps.

Best regards

Katja

entry.title: WEBI : filtre conserv√©
entry.content:

entry.title: Unlocking the Future of Finance with SAP Services and Support at SAP Connect 2025
entry.content:
Finance organizations are under increasing pressure to deliver more value, ensure compliance, and drive agility in a rapidly evolving business landscape. At SAP Connect 2025, the Financial Management track will spotlight how SAP Services and Support empowers finance leaders and their teams to onboard faster, monitor smarter, and innovate continuously with AI and cloud-enabled solutions.

üìå Don‚Äôt miss these must-attend sessions‚Äîadd them to your agenda today:

Onboarding financial management solutions from SAP (FIN1227)

üìÖ Tuesday, October 7, 2025 | üïú 1:30 PM ‚Äì 2:45 PM PDT

üìç Fontainebleau | CS&D Social Card
Speaker: Deepa B

Have you recently purchased a financial management solution from SAP? Learn how our Customer Onboarding groupaccelerates adoption with provisioning, setup, and enablement services across private cloud, public cloud, and SAP Business Transformation Platform.

Understand performance monitoring from an end-user perspective (FIN1434)

üìÖ Tuesday, October 7, 2025 | üïû 3:30 PM ‚Äì 4:45 PM PDT
üìç Resort World | CS&D Social Card
Speaker: Umesh Jagadesh

Discover how real user monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM ensures your financial applications deliver the right performance. Gain visibility into user experiences across regions and use proactive insights to reduce downtime and optimize operations.

Accenture‚Äôs winning strategy with custom AI extensions (FIN1691)

üìÖ Wednesday, October 8, 2025 | üï• 10:30 AM ‚Äì 10:50 AM PDT
üìç Fontainebleau | Social Card with Customer (L1)
Speakers: Sindhu Gangadharan (SAP), Michalene Schechter (Accenture)

Learn how Accenture extends SAP Business Suite with custom AI applications that integrate context-rich data and embedded AI agents. See how clean-core principles and a cloud operating model unlock competitive advantage.

Empowering finance with AI-driven collaboration and cloud ERP value (FIN1429)

üìÖ Wednesday, October 8, 2025 | üïù 2:45 PM ‚Äì 3:30 PM PDT
üìç Fontainebleau | CS&D Social Card
Speakers: Stephen Spangler, David Courtney

See how finance leaders can harness AI-driven collaboration and SAP Cloud ERP to accelerate adoption, reduce risk, and continuously innovate. Learn how intelligent swarming and tailored services enhance agility, experience, and long-term business impact.

üëâ Whether you‚Äôre focused on onboarding new solutions, optimizing system performance, or transforming finance with AI and cloud ERP, the Financial Management track at SAP Connect 2025 offers critical insights for your success.

üí¨ Be sure to meet with SAP Services and Support executives and experts onsite‚Äîwe‚Äôre ready to guide you in protecting, preventing, empowering, and guiding your finance transformation journey.

üîó Register today for SAP Connect 2025 and start building your agenda!

entry.title: Transform Your Sales Strategy with GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 ‚Äì Now with AI Insights!
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-paced business world, sales teams need the right tools to stay competitive. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve updated our GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 course on the Enterprise Support Academy, now featuring a new chapter on AI for Lead to Cash.

This self-guided e-learning course provides a step-by-step guide to mastering the core features of SAP Sales Cloud, from system setup to managing data and optimizing sales processes. You can work through the material at your own pace, making it easy to fit into your schedule.

The standout addition is Unit 7, which covers SAP Business AI for Lead to Cash. While AI has transformative potential, its implementation requires thoughtful planning. Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll learn:

  • AI Applied to Lead to Cash: How AI streamlines the sales process, offering valuable insights to improve efficiency.
  • Machine Learning: Using machine learning to enhance forecasting and customer personalization.
  • Generative AI: Optimizing workflows and generating content to strengthen customer engagement.
  • CX AI Toolkit: Exploring SAP‚Äôs AI tools to elevate your customer experience and refine your sales strategy.

By the end of the course, you‚Äôll have a solid understanding of SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and practical knowledge of how to use AI to improve decision-making and sales performance.

AI offers great potential, but its implementation should be gradual and well-planned. If you‚Äôre looking to modernize your sales operations and leverage the latest in AI technology, this course is a great starting point.

Join us on the Enterprise Support Academy and explore how SAP Sales Cloud and AI can transform your sales strategy: GROW with SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 .

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud / Problem with the Migration of Contact Persons
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have a question about the best way to migrate a complex structure of contact persons. Our goul is that the migrated business partners have their associated contact persons in the "contacts" section in the general view of the app "Manage Business Partner Master Data" (compare screenshot). 

The issue is, that there are a few Business Partners that share the same contact person. If we only use the Migration Cockpit and the "customer" migration object, we would, from our understanding, create the same contact person multiple times if we tried to enter them in the contact person section of that migration template, because it always creates a new contact person for every entry. 
Given that, the next logical step would be to migrate the contact persons and the other business partners seperatly and then fix the issue with mass maintenace after that.
My question is, are there apps to mass maintain this information and if so, how is the process ? Or is this a limitation of the Public Cloud and we need to do this manually ?

Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE‚Ä¶ and what it is not !
entry.content:
Dear Max
yes, of course you can convert to SAP BW/4HANA at any time afterward, and also before the "lift&shift".
"Before" means you perform the conversion with the current set up of SMEs in the on-premise environment.
"Afterward" means SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS), who operate the PCE system for you, will to the technical conversion. 
The preparation, which normally consumes most of the BW/4HANA conversion effort, will still rely on your resources in both cases.
Regards Frank

entry.title: Re: Service Interfaces and ABAP Proxy generation support in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi Helmut,

The support for ESR standalone also will end by 2027(ext.support end of 2030). Cloud Integration is seen as successor for ESR.

Support for ABAP Proxy generation is also now possible with SAP Integration Suite. In SPROXY transaction it is now possible to configure the IS tenant url in SM59 destination (SAP_PROXY_ESR). I will soon publish the blog for the same.Meanwhile  you can refer to the documentation :

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/generating-abap-proxy?locale=en-US&version=CLOUD

Regards,

Radhika

entry.title: Re: Issue with Company Code and Purchasing Details Not Up...
entry.content:
Possible root cause could be missing Role segment in Payload. The API_BUSINESS_PARTNER requires specific segments for each BP role:

  • Company Code Data ‚Üí BusinessPartnerRole = FLVN00 (Vendor: FI role)
  • Purchasing Data ‚Üí BusinessPartnerRole = FLVN01 (Vendor: Purchasing role)

If these roles or their associated data structures are missing or incomplete in the CPI payload, SAP will create the BP but skip those details.

entry.title: Cloud Print Manager for SAP Byd Print Service and Print Watcher
entry.content:
In the Windows services you will find the sap cloud print service and the SAP cloud print watcher screenshot (CPM1)

While the SAP Cloud Print Service needs to be started as shown in screenshot (CPM2) even with a local windows admin user.

The watcher can be started via the local service directly (CPM3).

 

The print service needs to run to ensure printing, while the Watcher is optional as the watcher "observes" the print service only.

entry.title: Re: Stock Quantity and Total Stock are not equal in TC: MB5K
entry.content:
While it is not clear from your post as to whether any recent changes happened to material master data for these materials, some of the root causes are

  • Valuation area 5792 may have inconsistent settings or missing account determination.
  • The material may have stock quantity but no value, or vice versa. This often happens if Goods movements were posted without proper valuation and Material master lacks correct valuation class or price control settings.
  • If Price Control is set to Standard (S) but no standard price is maintained, the system cannot calculate value. If set to Moving Average (V), and goods are received without price, value may be zero.
  • Goods receipts or issues may be posted without proper accounting entries. Check for material documents without accounting documents (use MB51 and MB03).
  • If the material is managed in a different unit or currency, conversion issues may cause value mismatch.

entry.title: Understanding Release Contracts (C0‚ÄìC3) in S/4HANA Repository Objects
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog is the first in a short series about extension and API stability in S/4HANA. In this post I‚Äôll explain release contracts (also known as stability contracts) ‚Äî what they are, why SAP uses them, and how they affect the objects you work with every day.

A Release Contract is a classification that indicates how stable a repository object is and how it can be used or extended. It‚Äôs SAP‚Äôs formal promise that certain objects will remain stable across upgrades. The goal is to strike a balance: on one hand, SAP keeps the system flexible so development can continue; on the other, key technical elements are kept stable so consumers don‚Äôt need to rewrite code after every upgrade.

To provide those guarantees, SAP defines different stability/release contracts (C0, C1, C2, ‚Ä¶). Each contract describes the intended scope of use ‚Äî for example, whether something is intended as a safe extension point, a stable in-system API, or a remote API for external callers.

Stability Contracts

       C0 : Contract for Extensions

       C1 : Contract for System Internal Use

       C2 : Contract for Remote API Use

       C3 : Manage Configuration Content

       C4 : Use in ABAP Managed Database Procedure ( Not covered in this blog )

Let us look at how these Contracts apply to comman repository Objects.

CDS Views : CDS views are one of the most common repository objects you‚Äôll come across in S/4HANA. SAP uses release contracts to make clear whether a CDS view can be extended, consumed inside the system, or even exposed to the outside world.

  • C0 - Extend

    • A C0 contract means the CDS view can be safely extended
    • There are two main ways to extend
      • Key user Extensibility : add your own custom fields (or sometimes even make standard fields available) using the Custom Fields app in FIORI.
      • Developer Extensibility : Use ABAP Development Tools (ADT) to create a CDS view extension. This lets you add fields or annotations to the view in a controlled way.
    • The promise here is that the structure of the view won‚Äôt change in a way that breaks your code across upgrades.

            

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the CDS view is a stable API for internal consumption.

    • You can safely use a C1 released CDS in :
      • Key user Extensibility : For Analytical Queries, Custom CDS Views
      • Developer Extensibility : In Custom ABAP code in ABAP Cloud or S/4 HANA Cloud.
    • In both cases, the base CDS view provides stable ‚Äúanchors‚Äù where your extensions will survive upgrades.

          

  • C2 - Remote APIs

    • Sometimes the data in a CDS view isn‚Äôt just needed internally, but also by external systems.

    • In those cases, SAP exposes the CDS via an OData service (or other service binding).
    • When a CDS view is published for remote consumption, it carries a C2 contract. This ensures the external API is technically stable for side-by-side or third-party integrations.

                

 

Database Tables : Database tables are the lowest-level repository objects in the system. In Practice SAP most often delivers these with C3 ( Manage Configuration Content ).

Tables can also be prepared by the provider for C0 ( Developer Extensibility ) using specific Annotation and release state settings - but this is an opt-in decision design. Most standard tables are not exposed this way , because SAP prefers that extensions happen via CDS views.

The release contract you‚Äôll find for tables is C3 ‚Äì Manage Configuration Content.

  • C3 - Manage Configuration Content

    • A C3 contract means the table is intended for storing configuration data (for example, customizing or setup values).
    • With C3, SAP promises that the persistence and structure of the table will remain stable so that tools can reliably export, import, or transport configuration across systems.
  • Why Not C0 or C1 for tables ?
    • No C1: Tables are not meant to be consumed directly in ABAP Cloud development. If you need business data, you should always go through a released CDS view
    • C0 possible but rare : SAP does allow tables to be released with C0 if explicitly enabled by the provider (using annotations), but most delivered tables are not. Instead, SAP recommends CDS views or the Custom Fields app for extensibility. 

          

 

Behavior Defination ( RAP Business Object ) : Behavior definitions describe what you can do with a business object in RAP (the RESTful ABAP Programming Model) ‚Äî things like creating, updating, deleting, running validations, or triggering actions. 

Unlike CDS views, most SAP-delivered behavior definitions are released with C1 (System-Internal Use). A C0 contract for behavior definitions is technically possible (the framework supports it if the provider enables extension anchors), but in practice it is rare. You should always check the API State in ADT to see what‚Äôs allowed.

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the business object is safe to consume inside the system, but not open for developer extensions. 
    • You Can :
      • Call the BO‚Äôs actions and operations in your own ABAP Cloud code.
      • Bind the BO to a Fiori Elements app and use it in your custom applications.
      • Rely on its structure to remain stable across upgrades.

 

Conclusion

This blog focused on SAP-delivered objects and how SAP marks their stability (C0‚ÄìC3): CDS views (C0 for extension, C1 for in-system use, C2 for remote APIs), behavior definitions (generally C1 for consumption; C0 only if explicitly enabled), and database tables (commonly C3 for configuration; tables can also be prepared for C0, but that is opt-in).. Although there are other blogs that go deep into specific object types, this post is meant as a pre-read to give you the holistic view. And if you want to actually find released objects and their contracts, the magic lies in the System Library in ADT ‚Äî and how you configure the tree.

entry.title: Re: Time off Finland - accrual rules and best practices p...
entry.content:
Hi @laurasanchezf 

We discussed with stakeholders who gave us these requirements. There are two parts

1) Parental Leave for multiple children:  This can be best handled using this blog where you could have for example three-time types for each child (one) and then you can count those time types within the accrual rule just like any other time type 

https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/parental-leave-ireland-solution-proposal-in-successfactors-time-management/ba-p/13579269

2) Regarding the counting mechanism itself. Our stakeholders mentioned that if we are counting the days/limit including the Saturday , it should also be counted the same way when deducting this for 14 day rule. Counting based on deduction (sat) for limit and using them in a different way (working day) in the rule is not in sync. Perhaps this part is more customer specific, and it is challenging to address different units in counting limits but using them in working days in accrual rule deduction to cater to 14 day rule

Perhaps what can be done is if the limit is 5 -10 days , then you could deduct 1 working day. 10-15 days -> 2 working days etc from overall limit which was exceeded (in this example 12 days). This may not be very accurate though

@monicareidl 

Thanks & Regards

Neelesh

entry.title: Re: What is the url for SAP FIORI to acces from chrome
entry.content: If you are using GUI, type /n/ui2/flp as a tcode and the url in the browser will open..save it as bookmark or do whatever you want

entry.title: Re: Use case of MMRV
entry.content: Even though OMSY can set the initial period and allow postings to the previous period during setup, MMRV is the operational tool used to enable or disable backposting during regular business operations. It ensures flexibility for delayed entries without compromising period integrity.

entry.title: Re: Not Assigned functional area COGS Account for semi fi...
entry.content:
Dear Lakshmipathi,

Thank you for the advice. This is regarding the G/L line item. Here, this is a consumption G/L in sap. This is semi finished goods receipt from the production. several entries has functional area and several does not exist the functional area in line item. when viewing in the line item, when view the MIGO doc there is functional area as attached ss showing.

  • Which transaction created these G/L entries (FB50, MIRO, F‚Äë28, etc.)?- T code is used  for this is MIGO.
  • Which G/L accounts are affected (P&L or balance sheet)?-  Both- Semi F/G DR & Stocks Cr
  • Is document splitting active in their system?
  • Is the functional area maintained in the G/L master data (FS00)?- No. it is free.
  • Are they expecting functional area from a cost center, order, or WBS?
  • Is this issue happening for all postings or only specific scenarios?- Not all, Semi FG item 
  • Do they have any substitution rules for functional area in OBBH? - No

entry.title: Re: Curriculum Requirements with Retraining
entry.content: Hi Harisree, how would you break the completion link from previous years? I thought about creating a revision or by copying the item and placing it in the item pool of the next year (so the LMS considers it as a new item). In that way, the users would be assigned a new curriculum with new requirement and new items, so they start from zero again. Here the problem will be that the user would be able to follow the courses again in the new year.

entry.title: Re: Document type MK not allowed with doc. category F (Pl...
entry.content:
Go to OLME ‚Üí Define Document Types.  Select document type MK or the customized one. Ensure that:

  • Document Category = F (for contracts).
  • Release Order Indicator is set correctly.
  • Item Categories are appropriate for contract release.

If MK or the customized one is not properly configured for category F, you‚Äôll get the error you mentioned.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud RAP Custom entity unmanaged how to u...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question!

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To update a custom entity in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition without updating the underlying table, you can use the concept of unmanaged scenarios in the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP). In unmanaged scenarios, you have full control over the behavior of the entity, including how updates are handled.

Steps to Update an Unmanaged Entity

  1. Define the Custom Entity: Create a custom entity using the ABAP Development Tools (ADT). This entity will represent your business object.

  2. Implement the Behavior: In unmanaged scenarios, you need to implement the behavior of the entity manually. This includes defining how the update operation should be handled. You can use ABAP code to specify that the update should not affect the underlying table.

  3. Use EML (Entity Manipulation Language): Custom data as table, CDS, Domain, Business object‚Ä¶ - SAP Community EML allows you to perform operations on entities. You can use EML to update the entity without affecting the table. This involves writing ABAP code that specifies the update logic.

  4. Testing: Ensure that your implementation correctly updates the entity without modifying the table. You can test this using transaction codes or custom applications.

Example

Here is a simple example of how you might implement an update operation using EML:

DATA update_tab TYPE TABLE FOR UPDATE my_custom_entity.
update_tab = VALUE #( ( entityID = '001' fieldToUpdate = 'New Value' ) ).
MODIFY ENTITIES OF my_custom_entity
  ENTITY my_entity
  UPDATE FIELDS ( fieldToUpdate )
  WITH update_tab.
COMMIT ENTITIES.

This code updates the fieldToUpdate of my_custom_entity without directly modifying the underlying table.

For more detailed guidance, you may need to refer to specific documentation or tutorials related to the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model and unmanaged scenarios.

[1] Custom data as table, CDS, Domain, Business object... - SAP Community

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Extract selected data from very large Hana table using sap Data Services
entry.content:
We would like to using SAP Data Services to copy data from SAP Hana database Production to the Test system,  for a very large table (over 1 Billion records), but only for specific selections.  So we currently have a Job with a Dataflow, with a query with a where statement and a Data Transfer transformation.  This takes about 3 hours to select around 6 million records.  Currenly all the data in the S/4 table is first selected and then the where is carried out.  Is there anyway that we can "push" the Where down to the SAP Hana database select?

We are using Data Services version 14.3.3

entry.title: Re: Delta Sync Issue in SSAM 2505 with Basic Authentication
entry.content:
Assuming that users will be using different devices, you could try setting the runtime parameter 'USE_SMP_DEVICE_ID' to 'X'. Use program '/SYCLO/CORE_RUNTIME_PARAM_PROG' to set runtime parameter value. After the parameter is set, devices must be reset. Refer SAP note https://me.sap.com/notes/2713969/E for paramter details. Please note that cloud connector supports many types of authentication but for SAP Service and Asset Manager, it is recommended to setup with principal propagation (i.e., cloud connector SSO).

Best regards,
Sriram

entry.title: How to Implement Triangular Trade Intercompany Business in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to implement a specific Triangular Trade business model in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

The business scenario is as follows:

  • Company A (Customer) places an order with Company B (Ordering Company).

  • Company B receives the order and outsources the production to Company C (Manufacturing Company), which is in another country.

  • Company C ships the goods directly to Company A.

  • Company B invoices Company A based on the order, while Company C invoices Company B for the production and shipment.

My main questions are:

  1. How to implement this type of intercompany business in SAP S/4HANA Cloud?

  2. What are the key configurations and document types (e.g., Sales Order, Purchase Order, etc.) required for this process?

Any advice or guidance would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

 

Best regards,

Angie

entry.title: Draft Enabled RAP Object with association [0..*]
entry.content:
Hi,

we are seeing this strange behavior that seems to be a bug. We have developed a draft enabled managed BO.  This object has the following associations. Both of these associations are not part of object hierarchy.

association [0..1] to I_OfferType_VH as _Type on $projection.OfferType = _Type.OfferType
association [0..*] to C_OfferBUList as _BUList on $projection.OfferUUID = _BUList.OfferUUID

The first association is a simple case of type for a document. So when we modify the draft value, the association uses this draft value to determine new value of _Type. This works as expected. User changes the object property and the new values are immediately shown to the user. 

The problem is with the second association. Here we have an association to many ([0..*]). Based on the value of the root entity property, we determine a list of subsequent objects. The current value of draft is being ignored and the logic to resolve data of association is still using the value from the original object. Once the draft gets saved, it starts fetching the correct values. This is too late for us. In other words, the property value gets changed on draft but the corresponding association is still showing relevant entities resolved with the original value. 

Why does draft enablement work fine for association with [0..1] but does not work properly with [0..*]? Is this a limitation of Draft implementation or a bug? It seems like a bug to me.

The stack is ABAP Platform 2023.

entry.title: Re: Conversion Exits and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)
entry.content: @ThomasPostl yes exactly. To make the OData exposure work no such conversion exits may be in the list of relevant fields. These fields can be removed from the view building, casted a a different data element or removed from the exposure via annotation "@Consumption.hidden:true". As stated in many cases the converted value can just be joined via view building means. A solution that always works out is to hide the field from the consumption and add a new virtual element that gets the converted value.

entry.title: Migrating Integration Flows with JDBC on Cloud Foundry While Using SAP HANA on Neo
entry.content:
Migrating integration flows from SAP's Neo environment to Cloud Foundry (CF) can be a complex process, especially when dealing with extensive JDBC requirements. This blog post outlines a practical example of how to manage such a migration while keeping the backend database in Neo.

## Background

In scenarios where the backend database is hosted on Neo, organizations may prefer to migrate it at the very end of the transition process. This approach allows all migrated integration flows in CF and existing flows in Neo to continue interacting with the Neo database seamlessly.

  1.  Setting Up HANA Service in Neo

To begin, ensure your HANA service is properly set up in your Neo account. This setup is crucial for maintaining database connectivity during the migration process.

2. Exposing HANA Service via SCC
Utilize the Service Channel Concept (SCC) to expose your HANA service. This method ensures that both migrated and existing integration flows can access the Neo database without interruption. See  Configure a Service Channel for an SAP HANA Database.

3. Configuring JDBC Data Source in CPI

Next, configure the JDBC data source within the Cloud Integration capability environment. This step is essential for establishing a reliable connection to the Neo database. To add a JDBC data source, see Manage JDBC  Data Source

  • Sample Integration Flow

Here's a sample integration flow designed to read data from an employee table in the Neo database. This example demonstrates how integration flows can be executed successfully, ensuring data consistency and accessibility.

 

  • Execution Results

The execution results confirm that the integration flow can consume the HANA database on Neo via the SCC service channel concept.

In summary, this approach allows organizations to maintain database connectivity during the migration of integration flows from Neo to CF, ensuring a smooth transition without immediate database migration.
